coverages.details: Covers irrecoverable overseas transport and accommodation expenses paid in advance if the trip is cancelled due to unforeseen circumstances like COVID-19 (must result in serious sickness). Cancellation event must occur after policy purchase and within 30 days before departure (unless accidental in nature). Policy must be bought three days (or earlier) before leaving Singapore unless the event is only accidental in nature. Eligibility for COVID-19 cover requires fulfilling relevant conditions (vaccination/tests if required) and the event meeting section requirements.

Covers additional accommodation or transport expenses if the trip must be postponed due to covered reasons occurring within a specified period before departure. No specific additional details found for this tier beyond the benefit description.

limits.type: Per insured person - Overall section limit
Per insured person - Limit for extra expenses to return to Singapore

coverages.details: Covers unused overseas transport and accommodation expenses, plus reasonable extra costs to return to Singapore, if the trip is cut short due to unforeseen circumstances like COVID-19 (must result in serious sickness). Event must occur after policy purchase. Policy must be bought three days (or earlier) before leaving Singapore unless the event is only accidental in nature. Eligibility for COVID-19 cover requires fulfilling relevant conditions (vaccination/tests if required) and the event meeting section requirements.

limits.type: Per insured person - Overall section limit
Per insured person - Limit for accommodation expenses per room per night

coverages.details: Covers reasonable additional accommodation and transport expenses incurred overseas due to serious injury/sickness, natural disaster, strike, riot, or civil commotion disrupting the planned trip. No specific additional details found for this tier beyond the benefit description.

limits.type: Per insured person - Overall section limit
Per insured person - For every six hours of delay while overseas (Adult)
Per insured person - For every six hours of delay while overseas (Child)
Per insured person - After six hours of delay while in Singapore (Adult)
Per insured person - After six hours of delay while in Singapore (Child)

coverages.details: Pays a benefit if the scheduled public transport is delayed for more than six consecutive hours. The delay must not be caused by the insured. Overseas delay pays per 6 full hours; delay in Singapore pays after 6 full hours.

Covers additional travel or accommodation expenses to arrange alternative onward transport if a connection is missed due to the late arrival of the incoming confirmed connecting public transport (minimum connection time must be met). No specific additional details found for this tier beyond the benefit description.

Pays a benefit if the insured is denied boarding on a confirmed scheduled public transport due to overbooking, and no alternative transport is provided within 6 hours. No specific additional details found for this tier beyond the benefit description.

coverages.coverage_name: If the travel agency becomes insolvent
coverages.details: Covers irrecoverable travel or accommodation expenses paid in advance if the licensed travel agency used for booking becomes insolvent before the trip starts. Benefit not applicable if policy purchased post-departure.

limits.type: Per insured person - Overall section limit
Per insured person - For every six hours of delay while overseas (Adult)
Per insured person - For every six hours of delay while overseas (Child)
Per insured person - Baggage delay after six hours when arriving in Singapore (Adult)
Per insured person - Baggage delay after six hours when arriving in Singapore (Child)

coverages.details: Pays for delay in arrival of checked-in baggage for every six full consecutive hours while overseas or upon arrival in Singapore. Requires written confirmation from the carrier stating the duration and reason for delay.

coverages.coverage_name: Loss or damage of baggage and personal belongings

limits.type: Per insured person - Overall section limit
Per insured person - Limit for laptop
Per insured person - Limit for watches, jewellery or valuables in total
Per insured person - Limit for other items (for each item, set or pair)

coverages.details: Covers loss or damage to baggage, clothing, personal effects, and valuables due to theft, robbery, or mishandling by carrier during the trip. Subject to per item/pair/set limits and specific limits for valuables and laptops. Depreciation may apply. Requires report to police or carrier within 24 hours.
Covers loss of personal cash, bank notes, currency notes or traveller's cheques due to theft or robbery during the trip. Requires a police report within 24 hours of the incident.

limits.type: Per insured person - Overall section limit
Per insured person - Limit for accommodation expenses per room per night

coverages.details: Covers costs of replacing lost or stolen passports, visas, or travel tickets, and related reasonable additional travel and accommodation expenses incurred overseas to obtain replacements. Requires a police report within 24 hours of discovery.

coverage_categories.category_name: Personal Accident and Medical Expenses Benefits

coverages.details: Provides lump sum payment for accidental death or injury resulting in permanent disability, loss of limb, sight, speech, or hearing during the trip, according to the specified Scale of Compensation (e.g., 100% for death/total disability, 50% for one limb/eye). Total payout from scale items a-h cannot exceed the benefit limit.

coverages.coverage_name: Public transport double cover for accidental death
coverages.details: Pays double the accidental death benefit specified under Personal Accident if death occurs due to an accident while travelling as a fare-paying passenger on public transport (bus, train, ferry, plane). This benefit replaces the standard accidental death benefit in such cases.

limits.type: Adult 70 years old or over (combined for sections 14, 18 and 19)
Limit for medical aids and equipment

coverages.details: Covers necessary medical treatment expenses incurred overseas due to accidental injury or sickness (including COVID-19 if eligible) during the trip. Includes hospital charges, surgery, outpatient treatment, and prescribed medical aids/equipment up to the sub-limit. Does not cover pre-existing conditions. Limit for adults 70+ is combined with Emergency Medical Evacuation (Sec 18) and Sending You Home (Sec 19).

limits.type: Limit for medical aids and equipment

coverages.details: Covers follow-up medical expenses incurred in Singapore within 30 days after returning, for treatment of injury or sickness sustained and initially treated overseas during the trip. Includes prescribed medical aids/equipment up to the sub-limit. Does not cover pre-existing conditions or COVID-19 related expenses.

coverages.coverage_name: Treatment by a Chinese medicine practitioner or a chiropractor

limits.type: Per insured person - Overall section limit
Per insured person - Limit per visit

coverages.details: Covers expenses for treatment by a licensed/registered Chinese medicine practitioner or chiropractor incurred during the trip or as follow-up treatment in Singapore (within 30 days of return) for injury/sickness sustained during the trip. Subject to per visit and overall limits. Refer to policy conditions for specific requirements.

limits.type: Per insured person - Overall section limit
Per insured person - Benefit per day

coverages.details: Pays a daily cash benefit for each full 24-hour period of confinement in a hospital overseas due to accidental injury or sickness sustained during the trip, up to the overall limit.

Covers expenses for emergency transport (evacuation) to Singapore or the nearest suitable medical facility if required due to serious injury or sickness during the trip. Must be deemed necessary and arranged by Income's emergency assistance provider. The limit for adults 70+ is part of the combined limit stated in Section 14.

Covers expenses for transporting mortal remains back to Singapore or costs of local burial/cremation overseas if the insured dies during the trip due to covered injury or sickness. Must be arranged with Income's emergency assistance provider. The limit for adults 70+ is part of the combined limit stated in Section 14.

limits.type: Per insured person - Overall section limit
Per insured person - Limit for accommodation expenses per room per night

coverages.details: Covers reasonable travel and accommodation costs for one relative or friend to travel to the insured if the insured is hospitalized overseas alone for more than a specified consecutive number of days (e.g., 5 days) due to covered injury/sickness.

limits.type: Per insured person - Overall section limit

coverages.details: Pays a benefit for each full 24-hour period the insured is unlawfully detained by kidnappers or hijackers during the trip, up to the overall limit.
Reimburses overseas administrative charges and phone call costs made to Income's emergency assistance hotline in relation to an emergency covered under the policy (e.g., hospitalization, evacuation).

limits.type: Per insured person - Overall section limit
Per insured person - Limit per item (for each item, set or pair)

coverages.details: Covers loss or damage to household contents due to burglary, robbery or fire occurring at the insured's home in Singapore while it is left vacant during the overseas trip. Subject to per item/set/pair limits. Requires a police report.

Covers the insured against legal liability (including legal costs) incurred due to accidental bodily injury caused to a third party or accidental damage caused to a third party's property during the trip.
Reimburses the insurance excess or deductible amount the insured becomes legally liable to pay under the rental vehicle agreement due to loss or damage to the rented private vehicle during the trip.

Provides cover under sections 1 to 25 if the claim arises directly from an act of terrorism (excluding nuclear, chemical, biological terrorism). The limits shown are the maximum aggregate payable for all terrorism-related claims per person/family across all applicable sections (1-25).

coverages.coverage_name: COVID-19 cover (for sections 1 to 25 except section 15)

limits.limit: See limits of respective sections that apply.

coverages.details: Provides cover under sections 1 to 25 (excluding Section 15 Medical Expenses in Singapore) if the claim arises due to the insured contracting COVID-19. Subject to the limits of those respective sections and meeting eligibility criteria: fulfilling vaccination/testing requirements imposed by destination/carrier, and fulfilling conditions of the relevant section (e.g., COVID-19 must result in serious sickness for trip cancellation under Sec 1).

coverages.coverage_name: Post-departure purchase extension (for sections 3 to 27 except section 8)

limits.limit: See limits of respective sections that apply.

coverages.details: Applicable only to Per-trip plans purchased within one day after departing Singapore. Provides cover under sections 3 to 27 (excluding Section 8 Travel Agency Insolvency), subject to the limits of those respective sections. Claims arising from events known, occurring, or taking place before the policy purchase time are not covered.

limits.limit: Covered subject to policy terms and section limits

coverages.details: Covers participation in leisure adventurous activities commonly available to the public, provided safety procedures are followed, guidance/supervision from licensed operators is used where available, and it's not an excluded extreme sport. Examples include scuba diving (max 30m depth, PADI cert or instructor), paddleboarding, white water rafting, skiing, snowboarding, bungee jumping, skydiving, hiking, trekking (below 4,000m on public trails or organised/guided), motorcycling, hot air ballooning. Excludes activities involving high speed, height, danger, specialised gear or stunts.

Coverage period automatically extends at no extra cost for the first 14 days if the insured is overseas and unable to return before policy expiry due to delay of public transport (not caused by insured) or hospitalization advised by a medical practitioner.
